name: llm-spellfixer
title: LLM Spellfixer
description: Spell correction powered by AI models with custom prompts. Supports OpenAI, Claude, and Ollama with configurable models and parameters.
author: vladimir_semashko

commands.name: llm-spell-correction
commands.title: Correct Spelling with LLM
commands.description: Uses AI models to fix spelling in selected text. Corrects selected text and replaces it automatically. Pro tip: assign a hotkey like âŒ˜+;

preferences.name: apiProvider
preferences.title: API Provider
preferences.description: Select the AI provider to use

preferences.name: apiToken
preferences.title: API Token
preferences.description: Enter your API token for authentication (required for OpenAI and Claude, not needed for Llama, can put '-')

preferences.name: modelType
preferences.title: Model Type
preferences.description: Select the model type based on your chosen provider

preferences.name: customModel
preferences.title: Custom Model
preferences.description: Enter a custom model identifier (e.g., 'mistral:latest' for Ollama) or leave as '-' to use the model selected above

preferences.name: systemPrompt
preferences.title: System Prompt
preferences.description: Customize the system prompt for spell correction. Leave empty to use the default prompt.

preferences.name: temperature
preferences.title: Temperature
preferences.description: Set the model's temperature (0-1). Lower values make output more focused and deterministic.

preferences.name: maxTokens
preferences.title: Max Tokens
preferences.description: Maximum number of tokens in the response.

preferences.name: apiUrl
preferences.title: API URL
preferences.description: Custom API URL (mostly useful for Llama, e.g., http://localhost:11434/api/generate). Leave empty for default URLs.
